alert.note: Alert for Central Marion; Eastern Marion (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 03 at 2:47PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Marion County through 315 PM EDT... At 247 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Salt Springs, moving south at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and minor flooding due to heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor flooding due to heavy rainfall is possible. Locations impacted include... Juniper Springs, Salt Springs and Moss Bluff. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
